text: Montigny-lès-Metz is a city in northeast France. It is on the Moselle River, near Metz. The habitants are called Montigniens. The first humans found in Montigny-lès-Metz were here since Paleolithic. ==Toponymy== Montigny comes from two latin words. * Mons = mount, mountain, height * Ignis = fire So, the fire mountain, because the Gauls start up a fire on the St Quentin mont to correspond with the other villages. Category:Communes in Moselle
title: Montigny-lès-Metz
